details: Orientation
E-waste Disposal Awareness Paper Presentation Competition
CA Pranit Jain, Director at Financial Planning Academy was the Resource Person/Speaker for the session. 149 persons attended the session and provided positive feedback at the end of the session.

CA Pranit Jain, Director at Financial Planning Academy was the Resource Person/Speaker for the session. 74 students, 2 delegates from Financial Planning Academy, Principal and Convenor from the college were present for the session. The students provided positive feedback at the end of the session and even requested for more such sessions to be organised.

The beach clean up was conducted on chimbai beach, on 9th January. The event was in collaboration with SWAN warriors. They conduct cleanups on beach in mumbai. Our nss unit has done most of the beach cleanup with them.
Mentoring session to FYBMS class to aid them chose between Finance and Marketing

Ms. Rakhee Arora from Heartfulness, Through Meditation and Joy conducted a workshop through Microsoft Teams platform on Manage Exam Stress - a heartfulness way - for students from all courses on 23rd April 2021 wherein 38 students were benefited.

A colorful and memorable fest was organized by our college named Nostrum social problems and financial solutions. Nostrum is an initiative taken by the student of BCOM (BBI) Nostrum 'social problems and financial solutions' was a virtual competition organized by TYBBI on the 1st of April 2021. Our theme was to find any social problems with financial solutions in PowerPoint presentations. This event continued for 2 to 3 hours and was held in MS Teams. In this event students from FY, SY, TY BBI took part in it. The chief guests, Mrs. Indira Singh (Assistant Professor Department Of Business Practices B.Y.K College Of Commerce, Nashik) and Mr. Nigel George [Assistant Professor, SIES College Of Commerce And Economics Sion (E).

Organised SEBI Financial Education Awareness Webinar for 'Global Money Week' for FY, SY & TY BAF/BCOM/BMS/BB&I /BFM/BSCIT Students (target group) on 25.03.2021 from 10:00pm to 11:30am at SEBI platform (WebEx Platform) Attended by 185 students
A guest lecture on Foreign Exchange Management was organized for TYBCom students. The speaker for the event was Dr. Elizabeth Rosen. The session was attended by 68 participants.

Organized 'KnowMo' day for students from different courses wherein webinars were conducted: 1. Mr. Madhav Mishra conducted a webinar on 'Overview of AI, ML, Data Science, Data Analytics in Real Time' -109 students benefited. 2. Mr. Kannan Maravar.S conducted a webinar on 'Overview of CoffeeScript and RoR' - 46 students benefited.
Event in collaboration with Charatered Institute of Management Accountants (CIMA). Conducted online via MS Teams. Attended by 178 students, 6 faculties, 3 CIMA representatives, and 2 judges.
Mr. Akshay Ridlan-Software Developer(BScIT Alumni) from Brenolabs conducted a webinar on 'Blockchain Technology and Future' for BScIT & MScIT students. 67 students benefited.
Techfest EDIT v7.0 was organized. Fest was conducted online; theme was 'VIRTUAL WORLD OF EVENTS'. About 150 participants in 4 exciting events.

Session on Financial Wellness held in association with the Board of Industry-Academia Partnerships on behalf of NSE. 2 time slots: 1) 60 participants from BAF, BMS, B.Sc IT; 2) 73 participants from BCom, BFM, BBI.

30 hours OPEN P-Tech course on Artificial Intelligence, Cyber Security & Design Thinking by Aspire For Her. From 14th Jan 2021 to 30th Apr 2021. 38(FYIT), 29(SYIT), 12(TYIT) students completed the course.
Mr. Sukamal Das from itvedant Education Pvt. Ltd. conducted webinar on DataScience Career & Job Prospects. 100 students benefited.
Mr. Anshul Gupta from ISDI School Of Design & Innovation conducted a webinar on 'DATA - FUELING THE FUTURE OF MANKIND' for TYBScIT & MScIT. 47 students benefited.
Three-day Heartfulness Workshop on 'Towards Inner Wellness' conducted via Microsoft Teams. 85 students benefited.
Microsoft ATS conducted webinar on 'Machine Learning' via Google Meet for SYBScIT & TYBScIT students. 86 students benefited.

A National Level Online Quiz 'Through the Looking Glass', on the occasion of Travel and Tourism Day was organised by Buddhi under the BMS Department. 217 participants attended the event between 11.30 am and 12.30 pm.
Bridge Course for FYBScIT students was conducted on 11th & 12th September 2020 by faculty members of the B.Sc IT department. 53 students were benefitted.
Orientation for FYBScIT students was conducted on 10th September 2020.
Ms. Aditi from Antarang conducted a 'Career Ready' programme via Google Meet for TYBScIT students (2019-20 batch) from 29th May 2020 to 26th September 2020. 29 students registered, and 15 graduated.
CA Pranit Jain, Director at Financial Planning Academy, was the speaker for a session attended by 149 persons. Positive feedback was received.

Organised session 'Multiply your career to 10X with Global Accounting & Finance' in association with ACBM Global Mentor Academy, Finplan Institute of Global Professional Education & ACCA. Held on 30th May 2020 from 12pm to 1.30pm.

As part of World Immunization Week, BMS Department, under BUDDHI, organized an inter-collegiate national level online quiz for faculties and students on Pandemics, Epidemics and Immunization (30th April - 1st May 2020). 471 participants joined.
An Intra-Collegiate Online Quiz for undergraduate students was organised through Google Forms on 2024th April 2020. 778 students participated and received e-certificates.

Marathi Vangmay Mandal organised Marathi Rajbhasha Diwas to celebrate birth anniversary of 'Vishnu Vaman Shirwadkar'. Prof. Avinash Kolhe conducted a session on 'Bhasha Ani Rajkaran'. A Marathi book exhibition was also held.
Session on 'Disruption in Banking Business by Evolving Technologies - Lessons for Education Arena' by Mr. Harihar Krishnamoorthy, FirstRand Bank, Mumbai.
The 'Know Your Economy' Test conducted by the Economics Department in collaboration with SRAEF, Chennai. 187 students registered, and 163 participated. Winners received attractive cash prizes.

Banking & Finance Exhibition - 'Vitha 2020' held. Chief Guest Mr. Harihar Krishnamoorthy. Exhibition theme: 'Financial Literacy and Inclusion'. 6 groups presented charts, presentations and skits on banking topics.
TechFest EDIT v6.0 - Theme: GAME TECH. 183 participants, 17 events, 100 volunteers.
Buddhi 2020 – Inter-Collegiate Literary Festival held at college premises. 40 volunteers and 90 participants (9 teams). The 7 events were fully paperless.
Fiontrai – entrepreneurial event for B.Com (B&I). Celebrated 4th year with 6 stalls selling tea, handmade cards, chocolates, nail art, toys, mehndi. Well received.
Double header sessions: 1) Seminar on 'Cyber Crime and Security Measures' by Maharashtra Cyber Police at BSE; 2) 'Student NLP and Memory Techniques' by Mr. Nishant B. Joshi.
BootCamp at DICE Ecosystem on 'Data Fueling - The Future of Mankind' by Mr. Vishal Samal. Target: TYB.Sc IT students.
Session titled 'Let's Talk our Mind' by Ms. Afsheen Khan, senior copyeditor at eClerx Services, for BScIT students.
Expert lecture with hands-on session on 'Hypothesis Testing in R' for MScIT part 1 students by Mr. Ajay R. Gupta.
Mr. Ananth Radhakrishnan from FYBScIT won 2nd prize in Discus Throw (Boys), Annual Sports Day.
NATIONAL SEMINAR ON INNOVATIONS IN SUSTAINABILITY ORGANISED BY IQAC, DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL STUDIES AND BMS
Discussion on Collapse of IL & FS
Volunteers from the BFM department gave a presentation on 'Innovation in Advocacy for Palliative Care'. Presented by: Ashutosh Patil, Aachal Shah, Siddhesh Waljankar.
Discussion on Making Logistics Humane
Guest lecture on Careers in Banking and Finance Industry in India and abroad by Ms. Rashmi Iyengar
